listDisplay.expandedContent: The sacred blue water lily of ancient Egypt, symbol of the sun, creation, and rebirth. Its flowers close at night and sink underwater, rising and reopening with the dawn sun. Associated with Ra, Nefertem, and the primordial creation.

growingConditions.native: Nile Delta and tropical East Africa

name: Blue Lotus
uses: Temple offerings - fresh lotus offered daily to Ra and solar deities
Funerary art - lotus motifs on tombs, sarcophagi, papyri
Ceremonial wine - lotus flowers steeped in wine for sacred intoxication
Perfume and oils - lotus essence in sacred anointing oils
Meditation and vision - mild psychoactive properties for religious experiences
Banquet decoration - lotus wreaths and garlands at festivals

sections.content: The sacred blue water lily of ancient Egypt, symbol of the sun, creation, and rebirth. Its flowers close at night and sink underwater, rising and reopening with the dawn sun. Associated with Ra, Nefertem, and the primordial creation.
sections.title: Description

safetyWarnings: may enhance effects of alcohol and sedatives
quality varies greatly - source from reputable suppliers
sacredSignificance: Supreme solar symbol. Nefertem = 'lotus emerging from primordial waters.' Pharaohs depicted smelling lotus = divine breath and vitality. Tutankhamun's tomb filled with lotus wreaths. Represents emergence of cosmos from Nun (primordial waters).
rituals: Morning sun rituals - opening lotus = Ra's rebirth each dawn
Funerary rites - lotus placed on mummies and in tombs
New Year festivals - lotus offered at Wepet-Renpet
Birth ceremonies - lotus symbolizes new life emerging
Coronation rites - pharaohs depicted with lotus (kingship and divinity)
Temple purification - lotus water sprinkled for cleansing
preparationMethods: Lotus wine: steep 5-10 fresh flowers in red wine 2 weeks
Lotus tea: 5g dried flowers in hot water 10-15 minutes
Smoking blend: dried petals and stamens (traditional)
Tincture: alcohol extraction for concentrated effects
Ritual bath: float fresh flowers in sacred bath water
Essential oil: rare and expensive, via solvent extraction
description: The sacred blue water lily of ancient Egypt, symbol of the sun, creation, and rebirth. Its flowers close at night and sink underwater, rising and reopening with the dawn sun. Associated with Ra, Nefertem, and the primordial creation.

activeConstituents.effects: Mild relaxation, dream enhancement, gentle euphoria, heightened awareness

legalStatus: Legal in most countries but banned in some (e.g., Poland, Russia, Latvia). Check local regulations.
culturalContext: Omnipresent in Egyptian art, architecture, jewelry. Column capitals shaped like lotus buds and flowers. Hieroglyph for Upper Egypt. Lotus and papyrus together = unified Egypt. Ancient wine and beer infused with lotus for ceremonial use.
